claimLOAN(uint256).details: Only a LOAN token holder can claim a repaid or defaulted loan.      Claim will transfer the repaid credit or collateral to a LOAN token holder address and burn the LOAN token.

params.loanId: Id of a loan that is being claimed.

createLOAN((address,bytes,bytes32[],byte.details: The function assumes a prior token approval to a contract address or signed permits.

params.extra: Auxiliary data that are emitted in the loan creation event. They are not used in the contract logic.

returns.loanId: Id of the created LOAN token.

extendLOAN((uint256,address,uint256,uint.details: The function assumes a prior token approval to a contract address or a signed permit.

params.loanId: Id of a loan in question.

returns.accruingInterestDailyRate: Daily interest rate in basis points.
returns.collateral: Asset used as a loan collateral. For a definition see { MultiToken dependency lib }.
returns.credit: Asset used as a loan credit. For a definition see { MultiToken dependency lib }.
returns.defaultTimestamp: Unix timestamp (in seconds) of a loan default date.
returns.fixedInterestAmount: Fixed interest amount in credit asset tokens.
returns.loanOwner: Address of a LOAN token holder.
returns.originalLender: Address of a loan original lender.
returns.originalSourceOfFunds: Address of a source of funds for the loan. Original lender address, if the loan was funded directly, or a pool address from witch credit funds were withdrawn / borrowred.
returns.repaymentAmount: Loan repayment amount in credit asset tokens.
returns.startTimestamp: Unix timestamp (in seconds) of a loan creation date.

params.tokenId: Id of a token state in question.

returns._0: True if the asset is valid.

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Handles the receipt of a single ERC1155 token type. This function is called at the end of a `safeTransferFrom` after the balance has been updated. To accept the transfer, this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xf23a6e61, or its own function selector).

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Whenever an {IERC721} `tokenId` token is transferred to this contract via {IERC721-safeTransferFrom} by `operator` from `from`, this function is called. It must return its Solidity selector to confirm the token transfer. If any other value is returned or the interface is not implemented by the recipient, the transfer will be reverted.

repayLOAN(uint256,bytes).details: Any address can repay a running loan, but a collateral will be transferred to a borrower address associated with the loan.      If the LOAN token holder is the same as the original lender, the repayment credit asset will be      transferred to the LOAN token holder directly. Otherwise it will transfer the repayment credit asset to      a vault, waiting on a LOAN token holder to claim it. The function assumes a prior token approval to a contract address      or a signed permit.

params.loanId: Id of a loan that is being repaid.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

tryClaimRepaidLOAN(uint256,uint256,addre.details: The function is called by the vault to repay a loan directly to the original lender or its source of funds      if the loan owner is the original lender. If the transfer fails, the LOAN token will remain in repaid state      and the LOAN token owner will be able to claim the repaid credit. Otherwise lender would be able to prevent      borrower from repaying the loan.

params.creditAmount: Amount of a credit to be claimed.
params.loanId: Id of a loan that is being claimed.
params.loanOwner: Address of the LOAN token holder.

claimLOAN(uint256).notice: Claim a repaid or defaulted loan.

extendLOAN((uint256,address,uint256,uint.notice: Extend loans default date with signed extension proposal signed by borrower or LOAN token owner.

extensionProposalsMade(bytes32).notice: Mapping of extension proposals made via on-chain transaction by extension hash.

getExtensionHash((uint256,address,uint25.notice: Get the hash of the extension struct.

getLOAN(uint256).notice: Return a LOAN data struct associated with a loan id.

getLenderSpecHash((address)).notice: Get hash of a lender specification.

getStateFingerprint(uint256).notice: Function to return current token state fingerprint.

isValidAsset((uint8,address,uint256,uint.notice: Check if the asset is valid with the MultiToken dependency lib and the category registry.

loanMetadataUri().notice: Get a loan metadata uri for a LOAN token minted by this contract.

loanRepaymentAmount(uint256).notice: Calculate the loan repayment amount with fixed and accrued interest.

tryClaimRepaidLOAN(uint256,uint256,addre.notice: Try to claim a repaid loan for the loan owner.

documentation.text: Mapping of all LOAN data by loan id.
Mapping of extension proposals made via on-chain transaction by extension hash.
@notice Emitted when a new loan in created.
@notice Emitted when a loan is refinanced.
@notice Emitted when a loan is paid back.
@notice Emitted when a repaid or defaulted loan is claimed.
@notice Emitted when a LOAN token holder extends a loan.
@notice Emitted when a loan extension proposal is made.
@notice Thrown when managed loan is running.
@notice Thrown when manged loan is still running.
@notice Thrown when managed loan is repaid.
@notice Thrown when managed loan is defaulted.
@notice Thrown when loan doesn't exist.
@notice Thrown when caller is not a LOAN token holder.
@notice Thrown when refinancing loan terms have different borrower than the original loan.
@notice Thrown when refinancing loan terms have different credit asset than the original loan.
@notice Thrown when refinancing loan terms have different collateral asset than the original loan.
@notice Thrown when hash of provided lender spec doesn't match the one in loan terms.
@notice Thrown when loan duration is below the minimum.
@notice Thrown when accruing interest APR is above the maximum.
@notice Thrown when caller is not a vault.
@notice Thrown when pool based source of funds doesn't have a registered adapter.
@notice Thrown when caller is not a loan borrower or lender.
@notice Thrown when signer is not a loan extension proposer.
@notice Thrown when loan extension duration is out of bounds.

@notice Thrown when MultiToken.Asset is invalid.
 @dev Could be because of invalid category, address, id or amount.
